name: andalusite
description: Andalusite is an aluminium nesosilicate mineral with the chemical formula Al2SiO5. A clear variety first found in Andalusia, Spain can be cut into an interesting gemstone. Faceted andalusite stones give a play of red, green, and yellow colors that resembles a muted form of iridescence, although the colors are actually the result of unusually strong pleochroism.
